body.name: Seventh Generation EasyDose Laundry Detergent, Ultra Concentrated: 66 Loads, Fresh Lavender Scent, 23.1 Fl Oz
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 8 hrs 20 mins

climatePledgeFriendly.details: Compact by Design (Certified by Amazon) products remove excess air and water, which reduces the carbon footprint of shipping and packaging.

features: Our Seventh Generation EasyDose Auto-Dosing Technology measures the right detergent amount—every time. Just flip the bottle, give a firm squeeze, and you’re done. One squeeze is all you need!
Ultra concentrated, ultra-convenient liquid laundry detergent : 66 loads in a compact 23oz bottle that’s easy to store, and easy to feel good about
Small dose, big clean: 60% less plastic, 50% less water, and 75% lighter than our laundry detergent liquid 100 fl oz bottle
Our liquid laundry detergent advanced-enzyme formula fights even the most stubborn stains
Concentrated laundry detergent made with 0% dyes, synthetic fragrances, or artificial brighteners
Refreshing lavender scent made from real ingredients: 100% essential oils & botanical ingredients in our washing detergent
body.description: "Life is complicated. Laundry shouldn’t be. With Seventh Generation’s new EasyDose Ultra Concentrated Liquid Laundry Detergent you get the right amount of liquid—every time. Just flip the bottle, give a firm squeeze, and you’re done. One squeeze is all you need! Our compact 23oz bottle gives you the same 66-load convenience you expect, but uses 60% less plastic, 50% less water, and is 75% lighter than our 100oz bottle. With a refreshing lavender scent made with 100% essential oils and botanical ingredients, and an advanced-enzyme formula that fights tough stains, it’s a great choice for your busy family. Easy to use, easy to store, and easy to love—our Ultra Concentrated Laundry Detergent is about to change the way you think about clean. Try with our Seventh Generation Dryer Sheets or our Liquid Fabric Softener - both available in Fresh Lavender scent! At Seventh Generation, we do business differently. We believe our products are healthy solutions for use within your home–and for the community and environment outside it. We are always evaluating how to reduce their environmental impact, increase performance and safety, and create a more sustainable supply chain. It is our responsibility to set a course for a more mindful way of doing business, where companies act as partners with other stakeholders to create a brighter future for the whole planet. Seventh Generation is proud to be a Certified B Corporation. B Corps are certified to be better for workers, better for communities, and better for the environment. By choosing Seventh Generation laundry soap washing detergent and both liquid and fabric softener sheets products, you’re joining us in nurturing the health of the next seven generations."

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Idea. Well thought through.
reviews.reviewText: I'm a big fan of Seventh Generation products, and this new idea of theirs is really a great one. This is a super concentrate and it works as advertised. At first, it made me a bit nervous to use the small amount recommended. How can such a small amount of detergent clean all of my clothes, I asked myself. Well, Seventh Generation has figured it out: this small amount cleans just as well as any amount of any laundry soap I have ever used.Also, the EasyDose feature really works! Just turn it upside down, squeeze, and voila!, a perfectly measured amount is dispensed.I appreciate being able to help the environment by using less plastic and less fuel in transport of this smaller bottle. It's also nice that this bottle's footprint is smaller, taking up less shelf space. One note I would give Seventh Generation is that the small bottle tends to fall over and sometimes even shimmy off of our washer from the vibrations of the machine (we keep our detergent on our machine, instead of on a shelf). I would suggest they consider a wider footprint to the bottle.Note: This review is for the Lavender Scent and to me the scent is nice and matches the scent of the formula in the larger (less concentrated) bottles.Useful Tip: Per the instructions, make sure to tip the bottle completely upside down before you squeeze in order to release the correct "dose". If you hold the bottle at an angle, it will keep releasing detergent without stopping.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Lavender is not over powering. Single pre measured dispenser works great and makes it easy to use consistent amounts. Cloths come out clean and smelling fresh.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A little goes a long way
reviews.reviewText: It’s hard to believe that about a tablespoon of this product washes a normal size load, but it truly does. I love how small this container is, and how perfectly the dispensing cap works. Lightweight, never spills a drop. The lavender is my favorite, Definitely not a powerful scent, very subtle. No more big, waste-of-plastic jugs for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cleans well, smells nice
reviews.reviewText: This Seventh Generation laundry soap does a great cleaning job and gets laundry as clean as other well-known brands. It has a lovely lavender scent which unfortunately doesn't linger. I wish it did. I love the fact that it's good for the planet. However, it is quite pricey. I will continue to use it though because it's a great environmentally friendly product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I really like how this detergent smells. I'm very sensitive to synthetic fragrances so most laundry detergents are much too strong, but this one is very mild and pleasant smelling. The dispenser system is also nice and not at all messy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lasts for months
reviews.reviewText: Great 👍 laundry soap. I really enjoy the faint scent after wash and dry. Not overwhelming at all. The built in dispenser is perfect, as I don't need to measure, just squeeze into washer and Go!I love how economical this soap is as it lasts a long time and I do at least a load a day, so I appreciate that I don't have to buy laundry soap so often, as I am forgetful.Cleans dirty clothes well, normal sweaty clothes. I haven't tested it for cleaning toygh grease stains like say a mechanics clothes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It last forever!
reviews.reviewText: I love this laundry detergent! It's easy to use with the pump, last forever, seriously! I buy this twice a year and I've got 2 toddlers.And leaves clothes with a faint smell of lavender no need for laundry softener.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I hate the packaging
reviews.reviewText: You turn over the bottle and it drips. And how hard he supposed to squeeze the bottle? If you don't use enough it doesn't clean well.This would be a much better product if it were in a pump bottle, which is what I am going to put it in.
..in Deutschland leider nirgendwo zu kaufen. Ich liebe dieses Waschpulver, da gibt es rein gar nichts dran auszusetzen. Es ist perfekt, Wäsche riecht gut und wird sauber. Sehr ergiebig.

reviews.reviewTitle: lavender fairly natural scent but still a little too strong for some of us
reviews.reviewText: One bottle received.Usually the so called Lavender scents of many products are not even close to Mother Nature's fragrances.As a matter of fact they are often too strong and chemical smelling.Seventh Generation has found a natural scent for their Lavender laundry soap with no chemically smell at all.Some of us are pretty sensitive to it so we are limited in its' use. ( no stars taken off for this )It does get clothing, bedding, dish cloths and towels quite clean; as clean as most harsher products available.So far we haven't seen any fabric 'wearing' or changes that usually happen with every wash.With the convenient tip and 1 squeeze per load it would be easy to get the 66 loads it says it can handle.Our problem with this is that we often do small loads and squeezing the bottle to expel a lesser amount is pretty awkward and can get messy.We've had to squeeze the full 1-squeeze-amount into a container and portion it out that way.Although it is a minimal inconvenience, it takes away a bit from the original purpose of just 1 squeeze per load.It does however give us a few more loads from the bottle so it balances out in the long run.For us, it weren't for the scent this would be close to perfect.First glance probably makes you think that the high price is too much but even at just 66 loads it works out to less than 50 cents per load.Doing smaller loads will obviously coast less per load.Seventh Generation products are fast becoming a staple in our household.They seem to be cornering the market for continually providing high quality, nature based products with reasonable pricing and a much lesser negative impact on the earth.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lovely Scent, Great Cleaning Power, Cool Auto-Dosing Technology!
reviews.reviewText: I am loving all of Seventh Generation’s laundry detergents that I’ve tried, but so far the ULTRA Concentrated Lavender is the winner in our household! The scent of this formula is just divine, and you can tell it is from an essential oil rather than an artificial fragrance oil.I was a bit surprised at the small size of the bottle when I received it, especially for the hefty price tag, but it says it does 66 loads - I guess it really must be ultra concentrated! It does a good job at cleaning my laundry, bedding, etc., and leaves them smelling lovely and just lightly scented. Another really cool feature is the Auto Dosing Technology: you simply tilt the bottle and give a good squeeze, and it stops releasing the detergent after the required amount has come out.Overall this is yet another Seventh Generation product that does exactly as promised, utilizes clean and plant-based ingredients, and delivers a result that is even better than expected. I am so happy with this company, and will continue to be a loyal customer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good cleaning power less than half the volume of regular detergent used in HE washer.
reviews.reviewText: The detergent cleans well and has a strong lavender scent that is noticeable right out of the washing machine. I don’t notice it once the items go through the dryer. The dosing system is really easy to use and I’d say it filled the detergent cup on my HE washer about 1/3-1/2 full of the ‘normal’ line - which is already not that much soap. So it is an improvement. I got one bottle for trial, but the page states this is a 2 pack, which would put the per bottle price in line with the regular 7th Gen 100 oz 66 load detergents. So you spend the same amount, get the same cleaning power and generate less waste. I think that’s a pretty good reason to at least try this detergent out. So far I am liking it and would likely buy more.

TL;DR Summary:Pros (+):+Good quality+Highly concentrated+Smells goodCons (-):-ExpensiveRead the full review for more.================The product does a great job at cleaning – and it is high concentration so you’re able to use a little but get a lot. That being said, I still think they are expensive when compared to competition especially considering you can now get detergent at the dollar store! No knocks on the effectiveness of this detergent, just on the value for money here.=======================Rating Breakdown (5/5)Product Quality: 5Ease of use: 5Performance: 5Value for Money: 1Overall: 4
